comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Such kind of things will never end on crypto exchanges. Rather, we will see an increase in such kind of cases and lawsuits due to the recent bankruptcy of FTX. Regulatory bodies will try to extract as much money as possible from the crypto exchanges for their own gain. But it will be not great if Binance is attacked openly like this on an ongoing basis. It will have an impact on the crypto market and may give the required push towards decentralised exchanges for good.

comments.body: The trick here is that if you do not know exactly who deposited and withdrew money one for one, then you can assume that it is money laundering. As such, this means they are just doing it to strong arm Binance and nothing more, and they can keep repeating it time to time but it just won't work.

comments.body: The 2 things are different.1) Money laundering is tough to prove if they are doing KYC in some real way and keeping records and tracking and everything else it is a somewhat easy fight to win.2) Sanctions violations, from what is being discussed is a lot tougher, you move 1 doge for some sanctioned business ¬†/ country it really comes down to a yes or no answer.
